results.title: Empire Games, 1962
results.brief_description: The official film of the 7th Empire Games held at Perth, Western Australia. H.R.H. Prince Philip attended the Games. This is a colorful and fascinating piece of Australian history featuring a very young Dawn Fraser in action.

results.title: Emotions of every day living. No. 6. First lessons
results.creator_credit: Howard A. Lesser, Mental Health Film Board, Knickerbocker Productions and Frank Beckwith
results.brief_description: A teacher is faced with many problems when an aggressive child becomes a member of her second grade class. The disrupting influence of the new boy, whose emotional difficulties lead him to bully the other children, is skilfully dealt with by the understanding teacher who not only helps the boy, but restores balance in the classroom by helping the other children handle their feelings. A problem in group dynamics is solved by adjustment which gives the children insight into the feelings that lie behind their actions.

results.title: Emotions of every-day living. No. 3. Fears of children
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Francis Thompson
results.brief_description: A film about Paul, a normal five-year-old and his well-intentioned parents. In a series of episodes typical of those arising in families with small children, it shows how Paul’s fears are related to his feelings about his parents. Fears not only prevent him from enjoying experiences other boys enjoy, but tend to widen the gap of mnisunderstanding between him and his parents. The film points out that Paul’s feelings are common to children of his age and may be accentuated when parents become either unduly protective or over severe.

results.title: Emotional maturity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A docu-drama depicting the immature behaviour of an adolescent boy who fails to channel his emotions into positive feelings and actions. After being rejected by his girlfriend, Dave seeks revenge by slashing her new boyfriend’s tyres. Deeper investigation suggests that Dave’s parents have contributed to his ‘emotional instability’ by treating him like a child.

results.title: Emotional and social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Discusses Erikson’s eight stages of development looking at the first two stages of trust versus mistrust and autonomy versus shame and doubt as applying to infants. A newborn baby moves through a development process to become a social being. Focuses on critical periods in development such as stranger anxiety, attachment, separation anxiety and preparation-individuation.

results.title: Emotion
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
What exactly are emotions, and why do they have the power to dictate our lives? The first part of this program discusses the question of whether there are emotional responses common to and recognisable by all cultures, or whether culture plays a significant role in how emotion is expressed. There seem to be three consideration when studying emotion: what your body does, what your mind does and what you have learnt to do, and the latter part of the program looks at anger and anxiety in particular and how these powerful emotions can be used or controlled with these three considerations in mind.

results.title: Emit
results.brief_description: Emit is a clock brought to life by the Voyager space probe’s final plummet to the surface of a post-apocalyptic, rubbish covered planet not disimilar to our own. Emit stopped at 11:55, as did the rest of the planet. Now he is ticking again, he sets out to find life and discover what makes it tick. But not everything is what it seems.

results.title: Emergency obstetrics
results.creator_credit: Medi-Cine, Pyramid Films and Richard Scott
results.brief_description: Shows emergency medical technicians how to assist in emergency childbirth. Demonstrates step-by-step procedures showing two live births and the critical situation of a prolapsed umbilical cord. Narrated by Lynne Littman.
